melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

translation.text: My self-conceit has been eliminated from my body.

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. The student is aware of the pain of learning, but is still conscious of the fact that ultimately it is for the best. In this way Ramkali conveys the change from all that we are familiar with, to something we are certain will be better.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: The Will of God is dear to me.

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. The student is aware of the pain of learning, but is still conscious of the fact that ultimately it is for the best. In this way Ramkali conveys the change from all that we are familiar with, to something we are certain will be better.

text: ਜੋ ਕਿਛੁ ਕਰੈ ਸੁ ਮਨਿ ਮੇਰੈ ਮੀਠਾ ॥

translation.text: Whatever He does, seems sweet to my mind.

transliteration.text: jō kish karai s man mērai mīthā .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. The student is aware of the pain of learning, but is still conscious of the fact that ultimately it is for the best. In this way Ramkali conveys the change from all that we are familiar with, to something we are certain will be better.

translation.text: And then, these eyes behold the wondrous Lord. ||1||

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. text: ਅਬ ਮੋਹਿ ਜਾਨੀ ਰੇ ਮੇਰੀ ਗਈ ਬਲਾਇ ॥

translation.text: Now, I have become wise and my demons are gone.

transliteration.text: ab mōh jānī rē mērī gaī balāi .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. The student is aware of the pain of learning, but is still conscious of the fact that ultimately it is for the best. In this way Ramkali conveys the change from all that we are familiar with, to something we are certain will be better.

text: ਬੁਝਿ ਗਈ ਤ੍ਰਿਸਨ ਨਿਵਾਰੀ ਮਮਤਾ ਗੁਰਿ ਪੂਰੈ ਲੀਓ ਸਮਝਾਇ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: My thirst is quenched, and my attachment is dispelled. The Perfect Guru has instructed me. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: bujh gaī trisan nivārī mamatā gur pūrai līō samajhāi .1. rahāu .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. The student is aware of the pain of learning, but is still conscious of the fact that ultimately it is for the best. In this way Ramkali conveys the change from all that we are familiar with, to something we are certain will be better.

text: ਜੋ ਜੋ ਕੀਨੋ ਹਮ ਤਿਸ ਕੇ ਦਾਸ ॥

translation.text: Whoever You have created, I am his slave.

transliteration.text: jō jō kīnō ham tis kē dās .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. The student is aware of the pain of learning, but is still conscious of the fact that ultimately it is for the best. text: ਜਾ ਕਉ ਗੁਰਿ ਹਰਿ ਦੀਏ ਸੂਖਾ ॥

translation.text: One whom the Guru, the Lord, blesses with peace,

transliteration.text: jā kau gur har dīē sūkhā .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. The student is aware of the pain of learning, but is still conscious of the fact that ultimately it is for the best. text: ਤਾ ਕਉ ਬਹੁਰਿ ਨ ਲਾਗਹਿ ਦੂਖਾ ॥

translation.text: does not suffer in pain any longer.

transliteration.text: tā kau bahur n lāgah dūkhā .
